physical_description: Extent: 38 leaves : paper ; 178 x 135 (140 x 110) mm bound to 180 x 140 mm
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title from title page (fol. 2a).|Marginal annotations. Biographical note on the author of text 1 on fol. 2a. On fol. 33b, statement by the copyist Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ghazzī al-Muqrī, dated Rabīʻ al-Ākhirah 896 [1491], stating he received an ijāzah from the author of Kitāb al-Ḥabs fī al-tuhmah, with the signatures of two witnesses. On fol. 37a, statement by the same, stating he received an ijāzah from Kamāl ibn Shihāb al-Dīn al-Nīsābūrī, dated Jumādá al-Ākhirah 875 or 895 [1470 or 1490], signed by the latter (fol. 37a). Inscription "505" in black ink, using Western numerals on the upper cover.|Collation: Paper ; fol. 38 + i ; catchwords ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 23-25 lines per page.|Description: Written in in medium small script in black ink ; rubricated ; overlining, re-inking and other use of red.|Paper: Light cream paper with pulp visible.|Origin: [Fāḍiḥat al-mulḥidīn] Copied for himself by Ibrāhīm ibn Mūsá ibn Abī Bakr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṭarābulusī al-Ḥanafī, in Damascus in the Zāwiyat al-Shaykh Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥiṣnī on 17 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 890 [April 1485] (colophon, fol. 23a). This text was collated twice, the second time in Cairo (see collation statements on fol. 23a) -- [Kitāb al-Ḥabs] and [Short treatise ] copied by Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ghazzī al-Muqrī al-Ḥanafī (Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-ʻĀmirī al-Ghazzī al-Wafāʼī al-Muqrī al-Ḥanafī, fol. 37a), the first in Cairo, in the Madrasah al-Ashrafīyah Barsbay, on 18 Rabīʻ al-Ākhirah 896 [Feb. 1491], the second in Jumādá al-Ākhirah 875 or 895 [1470 or 1490] (most probably the latter) (colophon, fol. 33a and 37a).|On fol. 24, reading statement ("ṭālaʻa fī hādhā al-majmūʻ") in the name of ʻUmar Ibn Yūnus Ibn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Ḥanafī. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

Cartouche in gold, white, black, blue, and red, with title written in white on a gold and blue ground. Roundel in gold outlined in black on the left margin. Ibrāhīm ibn Adham (fol. 1a). Three reading statements on fol. 226a: 1) Reading and collating statement dated 17 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 866? [Jan. 1462], written by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr ibn Zayd, mentioning also al-Shaykh Jamāl al-Dīn al-faqīh al-fāḍil Abū al-maḥāsin Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Mardāwī thumma al-Dimashqī al-Ṣāliḥī al-Ḥanbalī (with note by a later hand on the margin about Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad) ; 2) reading statement mentioning the names of Shaykh ʻIzz al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm qāḍī al-quḍāh Kamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Jaʻfarī al-Nābulusī and ʻAbd Allāh ibn Shaykh Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Zayd al-..., signed ʻAlī ibn al-Bahā al-Baghdādī ; 3) reading statement dated 12 Ramaḍān 906 [April 1501] signed Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Hādī.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda.

note: Ms. composite codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|The ms. carries the signature of Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Maydūmī (d. 1353, see fol. 20b and 22b), Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Jarādiqī (d. 1457, fol. 28b) and Muḥammad ibn Mūsá ibn ʻUmrān (d. 1469), and a text copied in the handwriting of Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhawī (d. 1497, fol. 25b). At least one text indicates a Damascene provenance (see fol. 30a). The ms. was endowed as waqf to the Jāmiʻ al-Azhar by Muḥammad al-Kaffawī (see fol. 31b).|Several audition statements, dated 709 to 783 on fol. 3. Reading statements on fol. 5a. Waqf on fol. 5a, 19a, 21a. Several audition statements follow the second text, some dated Friday, 5 Muḥarram 752 [1351] (fol. 20b) and Saturday 6 Muḥarram 752 (fol. 22a). Ijāzah on fol. 22b. Fol. 23 is on another paper, with a note signed Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī. The names of eight transmitters are mentioned after the title on fol. 5a, the first reading: "riwāyat Abī Ṣāliḥ ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ṣāliḥ kātib al-Layth ibn Sāʻd ʻanhu". The signature of the last one, Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Maydūmī (d. 1353; Cairo and Jerusalem), also appears on fol. 20b and 22b, at the end of the audition statements.|On fol. 31a: Title; waqf inscription in favor of the Jāmiʻ al-Azhar; label with the inscription "8090" using Arabic numerals. On fol. 31b: Waqf inscription signed Muḥammad al-Kaffawī for the ʻulamāʼ of the Jāmiʻ al-Azhar. The last folio (fol. 44) has been supplied by a later hand.|Collation: Paper ; fol. i + 57 + i ; some catchwords ; traces of numbering of the quires (see fol. 18: "thāni ʻashar") ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: Number of lines per page varies.|Description: Written in several hands on several types of paper ; sporadic use of yellow paper.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 10 leaves: paper ; 182 x 130 (130 x 95) mm. bound to 188 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Dark cream paper with pulp and a few lines visible. Marginal annotations throughout.|Collation: Paper, fol. 10 ; 110 ; catchword on the verso of the first and second leaf.|Copied by Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Jawharī on 6 Rajab 840 (colophon, fol. 10b).|Ownership statements on fol. 1a, one signed Muḥammad JGHNī al-Marīdī al-Shāfiʻī al-Miṣrī al-Azharī, who bought this copy from Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ al----(?), on Rajab 1, 1325 H. [Aug. 10, 1907]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Fol. i is a fly-leaf with a modern label. In this table as in the numbering in red ink of the texts, some texts here distinguished are not considered separate (texts 6, 8, and 11 in the table of contents of this record). On fol. 70a: Ownership statement and inscriptions.|Collation: Paper ; fol. (i) + 98 ; catchwords ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 19 lines per page.|Description: Written in medium small naskh in black ink.|Paper: Dark cream glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible.|Origin: [Tuḥfat al-ṭālib] Copied 20 Shaʻbān 814 by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Shāmah al-M[-]lī al-Ḥanbalī (fol. 23a) -- [Qāʻidah fī al-amwāl al-sulṭānīyah] Copied 15 Shaʻbān 814(?) in the Madrasat Abī ʻUmar? (fol. 29b) -- [Masāʼil fī al-ijārah] Copied by Muḥammad ibn Abī Shāmah al-Ḥanbalī (colophon, fol. 52b).|Ownership statement on fol. 70a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. composite codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Ownership statements on fol. 2a, 17b, 19a, 29a, 39b, 40a, 41a (dated 1026 and 1033 H.), 50b.On fol. 29a: audition statement (samāʻ). On fol. 39a-b and 40b: four audition statements, the first (dated Jumādá al-Ulá 564) and the third written by ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid ibn ʻAlī al-Maqdisī. On fol. 40a: appendix. Graffitis and inscriptions on the covers. Nr "52" in Arabic numerals on fol. 2 and lower cover.|Collation: Paper ; fol. 50 + i ; some of the texts have been collated ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 11-30 lines per page.|Description: Written in different scripts (medium small nakhi,) ; rubricated.|Origin: The only text dated is Qirāʼat Warsh, dated 741 (or 751?) H.

subject_as_recorded: Qurʼan--Readings--Early works to 1800|Coran--Lectures--Ouvrages avant 1800|Qurʼan|Muslim scholars--Certification--History--15th century--Sources|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton|1400-1499
physical_description: Extent: i, 106, i leaves: paper ; 180 x 110 (135 x 70) mm. bound to 182 x 115 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 2a).|Incipit: قال محمد هو ابن الجزرى يا ذا الجلال ارحمه واستر واغفر الحمد لله على ما يسره من نشر منقول حروف العشرة ... وبعد فالانسان ليس يشرف الا بما يحفظه ويعرف|Explicit: وليسمح الوجه بها والحمد مع الصلوة قبله وبعد وههنا تمّ نظام الطيبة [105أ] الفية سعيدة مهذبه بالروم من شعبان وسط سنة تسع وتسعين وسبعمائة وقد اجزتها لكل مقري كذا اجزت كل من فى عصرى رواية يشرطها المعتبر وقاله محمد بن الجزرى يرحمه بفضله الرحمن فظنه من جوده الغفران|10 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid lines visible. Marginal annotations. Fol. 2 consists of two leaves pasted to one another. Short text on fol. 1a. Table of contents on fol. 1b. Table of abbreviations used in the text on fol. 2a. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Qirāʼāt 6". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 432".|Certification of reading written by the author, dated 826 H. on fol. 105b.|Copy completed on 5 Ramaḍān 826 [Aug. 12, 1423] by Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Rūdāwarī (colophon, fol. 105b).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Fols. 276; 24.5 x 16.5 cm.; written surface 19.3 x 13 cm.; 17-20 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; with vowel signs; entries in red.|A fragment of a commentary on the Koran being the exegesis of Sūrahs VII - XVIII:109 (in part).|Beg.: سورة الاعراف ... بسم الله ... قوله عز وجل|Ending: ثم قال ولو جئنا بمثله مدادًا ىعني بمثل البحر|Marginal notes and glosses. Several folios supplied by later hand. Incomplete at end. MS in fair condition; mended; Arabic leather binding; blind stamped and tooling. Probably from XIIth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.|Cf. Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), II, p. 377.

title_as_recorded: al-Sifr al-awwal [-al-rābiʻ] min Kitāb al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-tanzīl /
title_as_recorded_agr: السفر الاول الرابع من كتاب الكشاف عن حقايق التنزيل /
subject_as_recorded: Qurʼan--Commentaries--History--11th century--Sources|Qurʼan--Commentaries--History--12th century--Sources|Coran--Commentaires--Histoire--11e siècle--Sources|Coran--Commentaires--Histoire--12e siècle--Sources|Qurʼan|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page of vol. 1.|23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with larger script for headings and for key-words such as "qultu". Annotations (often said to be from the author "khaṭṭ al-muṣannif") and collation notes on the margins.|Vol. 1, fol. 99-116 and 246-257 are later replacements. Fol. (i) and 274-275 (the latter: blank) are on the same European paper as these replacements. Some quires are numbered using Arabic numerals and abjad for the fol. within the quire.|Vol. 2, fol. 1a: Verses of poetry. Fol. 264b-266b: Blank.|Vol. 3, fol. 1-8 are later replacements.|Vol. 4: Several inscriptions on fol. 1a. Fol. 187-195 on smaller paper in another script. Some quires are numbered with Arabic ordinals, with Arabic ordinals for the fol. within the quire.|Waqf statement on vol. 1, fol. 1a (152B).|Vol. 2 copied by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Ibn ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn al-Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Shahrazūrī(?) who completed his work on Friday 6 Ṣafar 732 [Nov. 8, 1331] in Mawṣil (143B, fol. 264a). Vol. 3 completed by the same on Friday 27 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 732 [Aug. 20, 1332] (144B, fol. 283b). Vol. 4 completed on Thursday 8 Rajab [7]33 [March 25, 1333] (153B, fol. 340a).|Two spine labels (vertical) on each vol., reading respectively: "al-Sifr al-awwal [-al-rābiʻ] min Kitāb al-Kashshāf bi-khaṭṭ al-Shahrazūrī" and "152", "143", "144" (in Arabic and Western numerals).|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leiden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).

author_as_recorded: Maḥallī, Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1389-1459
author_as_recorded_agr: محلي، جلال الدين محمد بن احمد
physical_description: Extent: ii, 233, i leaves : paper ; 260 x 185 (180 x 130) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh. The Qurʼanic text is written in red, the commentary in black. Light cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and chain lines in groups of two and three visible. Occasional marginal annotation, including notes in Persian (see fol. 10a) and notes attributed to Tafsīr al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Kamāl Pāshā (see fol. 15b).|Chiefly quinions. The quires are numbered using Arabic numerals.|Decoration: Illuminated title page on fol. 1a, executed in gold, red, blue, and green. A panel outlined in blue with flecks developing from each outer corner is divided in two uneven parts. The upper part bears the title written in white on a blue ground with a rinceau in gold, in a cartouche on a red and gold ground. Small roundel in gold and red outlined in blue on the left margin. The lower part occupies 4/5th of the panel. This lower part is defined by green, gold, and blue lines and has a central lobed roundel outlined in blue with flecks and four rosaces in each corner. The ground is left plain. The roundel bears the statement of authority.|Origin: The copy is not dated, but the name of the copyist is given as Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Manṣūr, known as Ibn al-ʻAshrah. The illuminated title page, paper, and script, suggest Egypt or Syria, 14th-15th cent.|Several partially erased ownership statements on fol. 1a, one in the name of [...] ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥāfiẓ [...] bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-kabīr ; one dated 1151 H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Baqī ibn Makhlad, 816 or 17-889 or 90. Musnad|Sayyidah Nafīsah, 762 or 763-823 or 824|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632--Friends and associates--Early works to 1800|Qurʼan--Criticism, interpretation, etc.--Early works to 1800|Qurʼan--Recitation--Early works to 1800|Hadith--Authorities--Early works to 1800|Jewelry--Religious aspects--Islam--Early works to 1800|Muslim women--Biography--Early works to 1800
note: A collection containing:|1. A fragment of Īḍāḥ al-waqf wa-al-ibtidāʼ, a work on the pauses to be observed in the reading of the Koran, by Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn al-Qāsim ibn Bashshār al-Naḥwī al-Anbārī, A.H. 328 [A.D. 940]. See Fihrist p. 75. This copy is probably from XIIIth century.|Fols. 36; 18 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 13.5 x 11 cm.; 17 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red.|A few marginal notes.|2. A work by Abū Muḥammad ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Faqīh containing the names of the transmitters of tradition in the Musnad of Abū ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Baqī ibn Makhlad, A.H. 276 [A.D. 889].|Copied A.H. 784 [A.D. 1383] by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Nābulusī.|Fols. 11; 18.7 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 14.8 x 9.7 cm.; 18 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|Marginal notes and glosses. On the page and three folios following the colophon is a discussion of the legality of wearing silver rings, entitled Masʼalah fī al-takhattum bi-al-fiḍḍah, and of other legal problems.|3. al-Ajwibah al-zakīyah ʻan al-alghāz al-Subkīyah, a treatise on jurisprudence by al-Suyūṭī, A.H. 911 [A.D. 1505]. It is stated in the preface that in A.H. 876 [A.D. 1472] Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Sūdūn al-Ḥanafīi encountered some questions of jurisprudence sent in A.H. 761 [A.D. 1360] by al-Subkī to Ibn Aybak al-Ṣafadī in 24 verses of poetry, but that Ibn Sūdūn did not find al-Ṣafadīʼs answer to these questions; he therefore asked al-Suyūṭī to answer them. See Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), I, p. 158. Copy probably from XVIth century.|Fols. 6; 18.1 x 13.5 cm.; written surface 13.2 x 9.4 cm.; 21 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|4. Tarjamat al-Sayyidah Nafīsah, a biography of Nafīsah A.H. 145-208 [A.D. 762/3-824], daughter of al-Ḥasan ibn Zayd ibn al-Ḥasan al-Sibṭ ibn ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib. This copy was made A.H. 916 [A.D. 1510] for Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī al- Hilālī.|Fols. 10; 17.6 x 13.3 cm.; written surface 13.3 x 9.3 cm.; 13 lines to page; on glazed Arabic per; in naskhi; with few vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red.|5. Mukhtaṣar min kutub al-maʻānī fī tafsīr al-Qurʼān wa-gharībih, a treatise by al-Najīramī explaining the uncommon words which occur in the Koran. This copy was made A.H. 877 [A.D. 1472] by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Shāhīn al-Dhahabī from an old copy dated A.H. 587 [A.D. 1191].|Fols. 16; 18 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 17.2 x 12.5 cm.; 39-42 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; entries in red.|A few marginal notes and glosses. Title given in the colophon as Gharīb al-Qurʼān.|6. A fragment of a work on the biographies of the Companions of the Prophet.|Fols. 16; 18.5 x 12.6 cm.; written surface 15.5 x 10 cm.; 25 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi.|A few marginal notes and glosses. Copy probably from XVIth century.|MS in fair condition; stained with dampness; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūārūdi, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 419 leaves: paper ; 265 x 160 (184 x 107) mm. bound to 265 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from preamble of text (fol. 1b, l. 20). The same title appears in the colophon (fol. 417b).|Physical description: 33 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red for the commented text ; headings in gold (blue on fol. 259b) ; gold circular text-stops on fol. 1b. Thin dark cream paper with pulp and laid lines visible. The text is framed in gold, black and blue. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in blue, red, white , and gold on fol. 1b. Decoration in blue on the margin of the colophon (fol. 417b in the foliation in red ink). The text is partially vocalized. Ḥāshiyah (some attributed to Saʻdī Efendi) and corrections on the margin. Small piece of paper with inscription in Ottoman Turkish between fol. 154 and 155. Ḥāshiyah on a piece of paper placed between fol. 194 and 195, 203 and 204. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals (omits the first fol.). Lower margin worm-eaten. Last six leaves stained.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Tuesday 17 [Dhū] al-Qaʻdah 963 [Sept. 22, 1556] (fol. 417b).|Waqf of ʻĀʼishah Fāṭimah Khātūn bint ʻAbbās Çelebi ibn Khwājah Ṭūradī (or Tūraṭī) Muḥammad al-Marʻashī for her son al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn, the people of "baldat al-Līthāq" and the people of Marʻash (inscription fol. 1a; waqf statement after colophon, fol. 417b). Acquired by Robert Garrett from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.

At the end of the second title is an autograph reading certificate and ijāzah from the author for his son Abū al-Khayr and those who attended the reading, dated Friday ---? 803 (fol. 57a). Another autograph reading certificate and ijāzah for his son Abū al-Fatḥ, dated Īnkūl(?) near Burṣah, 9 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 804, on fol. 57b.|Layout: 10-11 lines per page.|Description: Rubricated ; cream paper with chain and laid lines visible.|Origin: The two first texts were copied before 803 [1400] and bear the autograph signature of the author. author_as_recorded: Abū al-Saʻūd Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1492 or 1493-1574 or 1575
physical_description: Extent: iii, 256, ii leaves: paper ; 205 x 155 (157 x 80) mm. bound to 208 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title provided by cataloger.|20 to 21 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Glazed European paper with watermark. Fol. 19 dyed in yellow. The paper has been frame-ruled. The text is framed within a gold and black border. In the texts in verses, verses are separated by gold borders (see fol. 87a). Illuminated headpices (ʻunwān) and divisions of the page with a floral motif in gold, pink, red green and white (fol. 2a, 4b, 12b, 17b, etc.). Hāshiyah written in a minaret shaped border on the margin of fol. 12b. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Majmaʻ". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 208/2".|Some texts are copied by ʻAbd al-Qādir, one of the disciples (tilmīdh) of Abū Bakr al-Marāshid in 1179 H. [1765 or 6] (fol. 161a). Others by Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad Khalīfah (Mehmet Halife) , known as Qurrah faqīh al-Lārandī [from Lārandah (Larende or Karaman), in Anatolia], in 1180 H. [1766 or 7] (fol. 208b).|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb (note on fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 252 leaves: paper ; 210 x 127 (164 x 73) mm. bound to 210 x 135 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 31 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink, with use of red for entries. The text is framed within two lines in red ink (gold outlined in black on fol. 3b-4a). Crudely executed headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold and dark red on fol. 3b. Gold text stops on fol. 3b-4a. European paper. Taṣliyah repeated on the margins. Table of contents on fol. 1b-2b. Inscription on fol. 1a. Fol. 251b-252b: Blank, except inscriptions on fol. 252b. Title on tail of text block.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Thursday last night ("salkh") of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1119 [July 1707], in Dimashq al-Shām by ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn Iskandar al-Istānbūlī (fol. 251a).|From the books of ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Ibn Ḥjj al-ʻAṭṭār (fol. 1a). Ownership statement in the name of Muḥammad al-Fāʼiq, muftī in ʻAyntāb, with impression of a stamp reading "Muḥammad Fāʼiq", dated 12-3 H. (fol. 3a). Waqf statement in the name of Muḥammad Salīm ibn Muḥammad Fāʼiq ibn Kūchak Ḥāfiẓ Efend[i], muftī in ʻAyntāb, for Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥusayn, known as Ṭāshjī Zāde, with impression of a stamp reading "Muḥammad Salīm" (fol. 3a). Acquired by Robert Garrett from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.

physical_description: Extent: ii, 248, i leaves: paper ; 250 x 178 (210 x 125) mm. bound to 257 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page fol. 1a.|Incipit: الحمد لله ذى العظمة والكبرياء والعزة والبقاء ... اما بعد فان الله جل جلاله ارسل رسوله صلى الله عليه وسلم بالهدى ودين الحق رحمة للعالمين|Explicit: عن محمد بن ابراهيم عن ابى سلمة بن عبد الرحمن عن ابى هريرة رضى الله عنه انه سمع رسول الله ... يقول ما اذن الله لشى ما اذن لنبى حسن الصوت بالقرآن يجهر به هذا اخر كتاب التفسير الحمد لله رب العالمين وصلواته على نبيه محمد وصحبه وسلّم اجمعين وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل|Physical description: 55 lines per page. Written in very small clear thin naskh in black ink, with use of red for overlining of the text commented and for headings. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in blue, gold, and floral ornaments in red, yellow, pink, etc. on fol. 1b. The text is framed within gold, black and blue lines. The name of the sūrah commented is written in red ink on the upper left margin of the recto of each leaf and on the margins. Biscuit paper, glossy, with thick laid lines and pulp visible; fibers visible on the surface. Collation notes on the exterior of the frame throughout. Note mentioning the number of parts, leaves and lines of the copy on fol. 248b. Catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: Copy completed in 1044H. (colophon, fol. 248a). Collated by Salmān ibn Muḥammad in 1161 H. [1748] (collation statement, fol. 248a, left margin).|Several ownership statements, some obliterated, on fol. 1a. One in the name of Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Lāhijī? states that this copy was collated on a copy read in front of the author (see note on origin) ; another is dated 1172 H. [1758 or 1759]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 77 leaves : paper ; 208 x 150 (175 x 110 and 185 x 115) mm. bound to 208 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|The title on the title page is from a later hand. There is no mention of a title in the text itself. The name of the author appears at the beginning of the text (fol. 1b).|On the title page (fol. 1a), there is a table of contents mentioning titles of works which are said to be included in the ms, though most of these works are not.|Number of lines per page varies (from 20 to 33). Written in black ink in a casual small to medium small naskh. Fol. 1 and 2a are modern replacements. Magical squares and talismans (see fol. 47b-49a). Marginal notes. On fol. 1a : several ownership statements ; seal of Muḥammad Saʻīd al-Minqār. Foliation using Arabic numerals on fol. 1-56. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals. The number "452" (corresponding to Brill's catalog) is written on the left upper corner of the upper cover.|Copied on 1 Muḥarram 1214 ("fī ghurrat Muḥarram sanah 1214" [June 1799], colophon text 1, fol. 56a).|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900, from the books of Amīn ibn Ḥasan al-Hulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).

author_as_recorded: Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Fāsī, Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan, 1193-1258
author_as_recorded_agr: ابو عبد الله الفاسي، محمد بن حسن
physical_description: Extent: 196 leaves: paper ; 265 x 175 (190 x 125) mm. bound to 270 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 3a). On the left margin, note: "Hādhā sharḥ al-Fāsī wa-hādhā al-ʻunwān khaṭā" (crossed out).|Incipit: يقول الفقير الى رحمة ربّه المستغفر من وزره وذنبه ... احمده حمد مومن موقن ... اما بعد فانّ جماعة من القرا المشتغلين بقصيدة الشيخ الامام ابى القسم الشاطبى ... قال الشيخ الامام العالم الحافظ المقىء ابو القسم بن فره الرعينى ثم الشاطلى رحمه الله بدأت بسم الله ... ومويلا يقال بدات الشيء وابداته اى احدثته|Explicit: وهى ذات حل فتامل ذلك والله اعلم وهذا آخر الجز الاول ويتلوه فى الجز الثانى سورة العمران ان شاء الله تعالى|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and commented text. Cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Fiber visible on the surface. Fol. 1-2 are apparently later additions on the same paper, with several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including a Kabīkaj and a dāʼirah, and a table of the names and dates of readers of the Qurʼān, presented in Persian on fol. 1b-2a. Leaves apparently missing between fol. 19 and 20 (see catchword on fol. 19b and numbering of the quire on fol. 20a). The quires (mainly quinions) are numbered using Arabic numerals (starting with "4" on fol. 20a). Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Note in the same hand as the second title on fol. 3a quoting the entry on this text in Kashf al-ẓunūn. On fol. 195b: Short text on the six reasons of illness according to the physicians of Fars, Rūm and al-Hind. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.). Title on the tail of the text block: "Kitāb al-Farīdah fī sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Qirāʼāt 15".|Origin: Copy completed on Friday 8 Ṣafar 858 [Feb. 1454] (in Arabic numerals) by Yūnus Ibn Aqbughā al-muqriʼ al-Mālikī (colophon, fol. 192b).|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb Ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir (ownership statement dated [12]71 H. on fol. 3a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: iii, 256, iii leaves: paper ; 253 x 173 (180 x 118) mm. bound to 260 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 255b).|Physical description: 21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh (professional hand) in black ink with use of red for the commented text (gold oultined in black for the word "Allāh" and for headings, see fol. 4b-5a and 21a). Yāʼ for alif maqṣūrah; final yāʼ dotted. The text is framed in gold outlined in black and blue. . Marginal annotations by several hands. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals ("354" on fol. 4). Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.). Stained with water.|Decoration: Now almost completely lost illumination on the first fol., with traces of a mandorla in blue and red filled with gold, and of an outer border in gold outlined in black and blue. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) on fol. (i)b, elegantly exectuted in gold, blue, red, and black, and bearing the title of the sūrah, the number of its verses, and a basmalah.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Tafsīr 10". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 1094".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Kamāl ibn Ḥusayn ibn Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad al-qāḍī al-Dizfūlī in Dizfūl "min bilād ... tān", under the direction of Saʻd al-Dīn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Shaykh Najm al-Dīn Ismāʻīl ibn al-shaykh ... al-Ṣamadānī, and completed on Wednesday 6 Ramaḍān 851 [Nov. 15, 1447] (fol. 255b).|Waqf (inscription "waqf" on the margins, e.g. fol. 21a). Ownership statement in the name of ʻAlā al-Mutaṭabbib dated 877(?) H. with stamp on fol. 255b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 207 leaves: paper ; 265 x 180 (210 x 145) mm. bound to 270 x 195 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 3a).|Physical description: 29 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red ; commented text in red. Important ḥāshiyah on the margin. Cream paper, glossy, hardly translucid, with a few chain lines visible. Fol. 1-2 and 207 are later additions (European paper with watermark), with inscriptions, including Kabīkaj, ownership statements, a table of contents dated Shaʻbān [1]203 H., and impression of a seal. Quinions ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first three leaves). Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "2" on fol. 5a).|Decoration: Illuminated title page on fol. 3a, executed in gold, blue, red and white, and consisting of a panel defined by a single blue line, with an upper cartouche bearing the beginning of the title and a lower panel with four rosettes in the inner corners and a scalloped central mandorla with the end of the title and the statement of responsibility, on a ground left plain.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Tafsīr 7". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "1135 Ḥ".|Impressions of seals on fol. 1a and 3a ; ownership statement on fol. 3a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Qurʼan--Commentaries--Early works to 1800
note: ff. 109. 270 x 176; 196 x 120 mm. 25 lin. Jumādá II, 1222, Walī al-Dīn ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭamūnī.|According to F. Meier, Der Islam v. 24 (1937) p. 14sq. this is a continuation of Najm al-Dīn al-Kubrāʼs ʻAyn al-ḥayāh by ʻAlāʼ al-Dawlah al-Simnānī (d. 736/1336) containing an introduction (incip. like ms. Hekimoğlu 54, quoted by Meier, 1. c. p. 14) and commentary on Sūrah 1 and 52-114; the same text also in ms. Berlin 874 (Brockelmann, GAL, S II, 281, no. 1); the title appears on fol. 17a: ... هذا الکتاب المسمى بنجم القران وهو المذىل للتفسىر النجمى کتبه الشىخ الموفق نجم الدىن داىه الاسد [ کذا ] الرازى ... من اول القران الى سورة النجم فلما وصل الى سورة النجم قال what follows agrees with ms. Damad Ibrahim 153, fol. la (quoted by Meier, 1. c. p.l2sq.) except that the present ms. purports to be a continuation of the commentary of Najm al-Dīn al-Dāyah, and not of al-Kubrá; the title Najm al-Qurʼān is mentioned by ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, col. 1930; another title appears on fol. 9b, immediately before the beginning of the commentary on Sūrah 52: ... هذا اول المجلد الرابع عشرىن من کتاب مطلع النقطة ومجمع اللفظ|Incip.: ... قال ... السمنانى ... النصف الاول فى الاصطلاحات التى لا بد للمستفىد المسترشد من معرفتها

physical_description: Extent: 267, ii + 3 leaves: paper ; 250 x 168 (190 x 115) mm. bound to 250 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 267b).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh (professional hand) in black ink with use of red. Dark cream paper, glossy with thin laid lines visible. Some leaves friable. Marginal annotations. Sheet of European paper with watermark, with text, placed between fol. 112 and 113. After fol. 267 are two later added fly-leaves of European paper. Three leaves with text, apparently from another volume, are placed between the fly-leaves and the lower cover. Two first leaves badly damaged with loss of text. Disbound.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Tuesday 22 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 684 [May 28, 1285] by [---] Muḥammad [---] ibn al-Ḥasan [---] al-Hamadānī (fol. 267b, partly erased due to water damage).|Several ownership statements, some with seals, on fol. 1a, in the name of Murtaḍá al-Ḥusaynī Alān-e Barāghūshī ; Ibn Mīr Murtaḍá [--- (obliterated)] Alān-e Marāghūshī, etc. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 475a). Title on tail of text block: "Tafsīr al-Kashshāf".|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh (professional hand) in black ink with use of red. Soft cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Fol. 9-12 are later replacements on European paper. The commented text is written in red on the margins. Marginal annotations on the beginning of the text, apparently by the same hand as the main text. Several inscriptions on fol. (ii)b and 1a. Table of contents by a later hand on fol. (ii)a. Leaves apparently wanting between fol. 6 and 7, fol. 61 and 62. Catchword on the verso of the last fol. of each quire (quaternions).|Origin: Copy completed on Friday, 14 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 808 [Oct. 9, 1405] in Samarqand in the mausoleum? of Abū Manṣūr al-Māturīdī by Jalāl ibn ...? (colophon, fol. 475a).|Inscription in red pencil in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "...? 34". Inscription in black ink in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 902". Inscription in black ink in Arabic numerals on the pastedown of the upper cover: "196".|Impression of an oval stamp on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 236 leaves : paper ; 182 x 122 (109-112 x 65-75) mm. bound to 184 x 125 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from spine label by a later hand; parts of label are worn away. The full title reads "Majmūʻat rasāʼil ʻadīdah ...-īyah wa-khilāfihā ... risālatān al-awzān wa-al-maqāyīs wa-al-darāhim."|Collation: Paper ; fol. i + 236 ; catchwords ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 16-17 lines per page.|Description: Written in small naskh in black on beige glazed, laid Arabic paper ; some damp staining, particularly toward beginning and end of manuscript, marginal insect damage.|Origin: All texts copied by the same scribe, Ibn Muḥammad Sharīf al-Khātūnʹābādī Muḥammad al-mulaqqab bi-al-Kāẓim, teacher at al-Masjid al-Jāmiʻ and servant of al-Rawḍah al-Riḍawīyah [Mashhad] (leaf 172a). Text 7 dated Ṣafar 1128 H [January-February 1716] (leaf 123a). Text 8 dated 25 Rabīʻ I 1128 H [19 March 1716] (leaf 172a). Text 9 dated 29 Rabīʻ I 1128 H [23 March 1716] (leaf 180b). Text 14 dated 5 Jumādá II 1128 H [27 May 1716] (leaf 215a). Remaining texts likely completed in the same year.|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).

physical_description: Extent: ii, 128, ii leaves: paper ; 267 x 175 (208 x 123) mm. bound to 267 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Physical description: 29 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red for "qawluhu". The headings are ornated with a small gold-stamped flower motif on a red or green ground outlined in red (see fol. 103b). Cream paper, hardly translucid, with laid and chain lines, and pulp visible. Quinions and quaternions.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Tafsīr 111". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 569".|Collation: Paper, fol. ii, 128 ; ii (free endpaper and later added fly-leaf) 16 2-810 98 10-1210 138 148 (-2 at end of quire) ii (later added fly-leaf and free endpaper).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed in 845 H. (fol. 127b).|Waqf statement in the name of Ḥusayn Pāshā [16th cent.], with seal (repeated on fol. 127b), endowing three books (Ḥāshiyat al-Kashf lil-Kashshāf from al-Fātiḥah to al-Maʻūdhatayn, in two vol.; Ḥāshiyat Saʻd al-Dīn lil-Kashshāf from al-Fātiḥah to the end of Āl ʻUmrān; Ḥāshiyat Shaykhzādah li-Bayḍāwī, from sūrat Tawbah to the end of sūrat al-Raʻd) for the Jāmiʻah [Lala Hüseyin Paşa Camii, built 1566-1568] built by him in Kūtāhiyah [North-Western Anatolia] (fol. 1a). Four ownership statements on fol. 1a, two in the name of the same Muḥammad ibn Pīr(?) Muḥammad Pāshā al-Jamālī [Mehmet bin Pir Mehmet Paşa], dated 919 H. [1513 or 4]; one in the name of Dāwud ibn ʻUbayd Allāh ; the last one in the name of Nūḥādīʹzādah, with seal reading: "al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī, 1274 [1857 or 8]". Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Sūrat al-Fātiḥah--Commentaries--Early works to 1800|Qurʼan--Recitation--Early works to 1800|Hadith--Texts--Early works to 1800|Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Islam--Rituals--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Muslim pilgrims and pilgrimages--Law and legislation--Early works to 1800|Prayer--Islam--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 221; 17.9 x 13.3 cm.; written surface 11.5-15.5 x 9-12 cm.; 17-21 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. A collection of fifty traditions of which the first five are lacking. MS probably from XVIIth century.|2. Extracts from Mawāqif al-ghāyāt fī asrār al-riyāḍāt, a work on Ṣūfī routine and offices of prayer, by Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Būnī, A.H. 622 [A.D. 1225]. See Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), V, p. 235; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 2843.|3. Selections from Kitāb al-Ādāb fī al-taṣawwuf, a work on Ṣūfism, by Abū Bakr ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Mawṣilī, A.H. 797 [A.D. 1395]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 3094/5. MS probably from XVIth century.|4. A number of Ṣūfī collects.|5. A commentary on the Fātiḥah by Zayn al-Dīn Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad ibn Rajab al-Ḥanbalī, A.H. 795 [A.D. 1393]. On the title page is a note that this MS was transcribed from a copy which was rescued from the fires when Damascus was sacked and burnt by Tīmūr Lang in A.H. 803 [A.D. 1400]. MS evidently from XVth century.|6. Kitāb al-Tabyīn fī aḥkām al-nūn al-sākinah wa-al-tanwīn, a work on the grammatical behavior of the letter nūn in the Koran, by Yaḥyá ibn Zakarīyā al-Ghūrī. The copy was made in A.H. 852 [A.D. 1448] by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad [?] ibn ʻAlī.|7. Al-Nubdhah al-zakīyah fī al-uṣūl al-fiqhīyah, a work on jurisprudence by Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Dāʼim al-Birmāwī, A.H. 831 [A.D. 1427/8]. See Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), VI, p. 294. The copy was made in A.H. 824 [A.D. 1421] by Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Razzāq ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Arīḥī [?].|8. Kifāyat al-rāghibīn fī ʻilm uṣūl al-dīn, a treatise on the articles of faith, by ʻAlī ibn ʻAṭīyah ibn Ḥasan, known as ʻAlwān al-Ḥamawī, A.H. 936 [A.D. 1527]. Copy probably from XVIIth century.|9. Tuḥfat al-furrāḍ wa-ṭurfat al-muhadhdhib al-murtāḍ, an iambic ode on jurisprudence by ʻAlam al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ṣamad al-Sakhāwī, A.H. 643 [A.D. 1245/6]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 4709. MS probably from XVIIIth century.|10. Mansik al-ḥajj, a manual on the preparation for the pilgrimage according to the Idrīsid school, compiled by Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Burayd al-Dayrī al-Qādirī. MS incomplete at the end. Probably from XVIIIth century.|MS in fair condition; Arabic leather binding with flap; blind stamped.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 24 leaves : paper ; 240 x 170 (167 x 115) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger from the titles of the two first texts (fol. 1a and 13a).|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in professional medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Frame of two red lines throughout. The text is vocalized. Thick dark cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Several inscriptions and short text on fol. 1a and 24b.|Ijāzah by Yūsuf ibn Balabān(?) ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-ʻAynʹTābī al-Ḥanafī for Nāṣir ibn al-Khaṭīb Najm al-Dīn Isḥāq ibn Ḥasan al-QṢ[---] (partly faded due to water damage), dated Thursday 4 Jumādá al-Ūlá 744 [Sept. 24, 1343], with a list of transmitters (fol. 15b).|Origin: No date mentioned in the colophon of Text 1 (fol. 12a, followed by lines of poetry). Text 2 is copied for (bi-rasm) al-Walad Aḥmad (see title page, fol. 13a). The only mentioned dated is Jumādá al-Ūlá 744 [Sept. 1343] in the ijāzah fol. 15b.|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, one in the name of Sulaymān Ibn shaykh Muḥammad al-Ḍurayr (Ḍarīr). The same name appears on fol. 24b, in a statement dated 1061 H. [1650 or 51]. Ownership statement in the name of Ibrāhīm ibn Thābit ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAbbāsī al-Ḥusaynī on fol. 15b (the same name, partly wanting, appears on fol. 1a). Ownership statement in the name of [---] al-Dīn [---] al-Ḥusaynī al-Shāfiʻī al-[---] al-Qādirī, dated 1006 H. [1597 or 8] on fol. 16a (partly erased, mention of price). Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad on fol. 23a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Durr al-multaqaṭ fī tabyīn al-ghalaṭ|Qurʼan|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Sufism--Doctrines--History--15th century--Sources|Islamic philosophy--History--15th century--Sources|Metaphysics--Islamic empire--15th century|Muslim scholars--Certification--History--17th century--Sources|Hadith--Authorities--Early works to 1800|Hadith--Criticism, interpretation, etc.--Early works to 1800
physical_description: Extent: 138 leaves: paper ; 205 x 147 mm. bound to 205 x 155 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Physical description: Number of lines per page varies. Written in casual naskh in black ink with use of red. Marginal annotations (glosses and collation notes). European paper (apparently similar throughout the volume). Table of contents on fol. 137a. List of works on fol. 1a. Biographical notes on Suhrawardī, Dawwānī, Fanārī, Suyūṭī, ʻĪsá ibn Muḥammad al-Maghribī, etc., including dates of birth and other such details, on fol. 3a, 23a, 43a, 101a, 138a. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "22" on fol. 3a). Lacuna after fol. 95.|Two reading statements on fol. 23a, dated respectively 1078 H. and 1084 H. One dated 1078 H. on fol. 39a.|Origin: According to colophons, text 1 copied by Yūsuf al-Tāj ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī al-Khayr al-Jāwī al-Maqāṣīrī al-Munjalāwī for his shaykh al-Mullā Ibrāhīm al-Kūrānī, and completed on 1 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1075 [Oct. 22, 1664] in Madīnah in the Ribāṭ ʻAlī al-Murtaḍá (fol. 23a). Text 2 copied by the same, Madīnah, 3 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1075 [Oct. 24, 1664] (fol. 27b). Text 3 dated night of Thursday 9 Rabīʻ al-ākhir 1075 [Oct. 30, 1664]. Text 8 copied by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jāwī al-Maqāṣīri al-Katūnūkanī, al-Madīnah, end of Ṣafar 1075 [Sept. 1664] (fol. 85a). Text 10 written by the author, 16 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1075 [Oct. 7, 1664] (fol. 96b, see however mention of a ʻAbd al-Hakīm ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jāwī al-Ghiṭānī ; collated 9 Jumādá I 1075). Text 12 copied by ʻAbd al-Hakīmal-Jāwī al-Ghiṭānī, 1075 (fol. 137a).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Fols. 112; 18 x 13.5 cm.; written surface 14-15 x 8-10 cm.; 10-19 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords.|A collection containing:|1. Bidāyah min al-Kifāyah, by Aḥmad ibn Maḥmūd al-Ṣābūnī, an abridgment by the author of his own work on metaphysics which is entitled al-Kifāyah fī al-Hidāyah. MS incomplete at the end. Probably from XIIIth century.|2. Several legal questions and their answers relating to the mortmain property of Abraham in Hebron by Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī, A.H. 852 [A.D. 1449]. MS probably from XVIIth century.|3. A correspondence between Abū Ṭāhir Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Salafī, A.H. 576 [A.D. 1180] and al-Zamakhsharī, A.H. 538 [A D. 1144]. MS probably from XIVth century.|4. Ḥadīth inshiqāq al-qamar, the tradition of ʻthe splitting of the moonʼ (Sūrah LIV:1). MS probably from XVth century.|Marginal notes. subject_as_recorded: Qurʼan--Readings|Qurʼan--Recitation--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Early works to 1800|Hadith--Texts--Early works to 1800|Muslim saints--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Early works to 1800
note: A collection containing:|1. A treatise on the readings of the Koran, together with the chain of recensionists. The title is given by a later hand as Asānīd al-qirāʼāt by Abū al-Jūd al-Lakhmī al-Muqriʼ.|Fols. 118; 19 x 13.8cm.; written surface 13.7 x 9.3 cm.; 13 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with full vowel signs; entries in gold.|A few marginal notes and glosses. Evidently several folios are missing between folios 109 and 110. MS is incomplete at beginning and end. MS probably from XXth century.|2. al-Arbaʻūn al-mukhtārah min ḥadīth Ibn Abī ʻUmar, a collection of forty traditions selected by Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Hādī from the corpus of traditions according to the recension of Shams al-Dīn ibn Abī ʻUmar al-Ḥanbalī. The present work was written A.H. 889 [A.D. 1484] by the author.|3. al-ʻAsharah al-mukhtārah, a collection of ten traditions by the same Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Hādī according to the recension of his father. This copy was also written by the author A.H. 889 [A.D. 1484].|Texts 2 and 3: Fols. 16; 19 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 14.7 x 11.8 cm.; 18 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in Fārisi.|4. Nashr al-maḥāsin, by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Asʻad al-Yāfiʻī, a collection of stories, prayers and verses of poetry illustrating the virtues of leading shaykhs and saints.|Copied in Makkah, A.H. 809 [A.D. 1406], by Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ghazzī.|Fols. 227; 19 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 13.5 x 11.7 cm.; 19 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red. Stated on title page that this is the second part of Nashr al-maḥāsin.|5. A section of Kitāb al-Irshād wa-al-taṭrīz fī faḍl dhikr Allāh wa-tilāwat kitābihi al-ʻazīz, a work on the excellence of prayer and reading the Koran, by al-Yāfiʻī, A.H. 768 [A.D. 1367]. On the title page this work is designated as an abridgment of the first chapter of al-Irshād. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 8101.|Copied in Makkah. A.H. 809 [A.D. 1407], by Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ghazzī.|Fols. 12; 19 x 13.8 cm.; written surface 13.5 x 11.7 cm.; 17-20 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords.|MS in good condition; Arabic binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 175a).|Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in medium large Maghribī script, in red ink for the commented text, and in black ink for the commentary ; yellow outlined in black for titles of sūrah. Occasional circular signs for ḥizb on the margin, consisting of concentric circles in black ink with four groups of three dots on the outer line (see fol. 154a, 160a). European paper (friable). Inscriptions in Roman script in pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover: "IL 58a" and "350 pp". Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (blank between fol. 157 and 158).|Collation: Paper, fol. 176 ; 1-1710 184 (+1 at end of quire) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on a Wednesday in Ṣafar 958 ("ʻām") (fol. 175a).|Inscription mentioning the date Rajab 1248 on fol. 2a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 56 leaves: paper ; 180 x 130 (130 x 105) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription in red ink on fol. 1a.|17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for entries and headings. The text is partly vocalized. Ligh cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. The quires (mainly quinions) have catchwords on the verso of each leaf. A few marginal notes by another hand as the main text. On fol. 1a: Table with letters of the Arabic alphabet with a short sentence linked to each of them, the first reading "ẓā : yanāl maṭlubahu wa-mafqūdah". Fol. 2a has inscriptions faded due to water damage.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on fol. 1a: "Ḥāʼ 138/2".|Copy completed in 846 H. (colophon, fol. 55a).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Several audition statements (samāʻ notes) on fol. 168a-169b, mainly from the Masjid al-jāmiʻ in Damascus. According to R. Mach, the first one is by the hand of Ibn ʻAsākir. subject_as_recorded: Zamakhsharī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar, 1075-1144. Kashshāf|Qurʼan--Commentaries--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800|Shafiʻites--Early works to 1800|Hanafites--Early works to 1800|Logic--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800
note: ff. 89. 190 x 107; 130 x 53 mm. 15 lin. 14th/15th cen.|Mutilus - the title appears in the introduction, fol. 2b.|The books on uṣūl al-fiqh as well as the commentaries on the Qurʻān abound with erroneous opinions and Muʻtazilite heresies, especially the Kashshāf; it is particularly this book which, due to its many outstanding qualities, represents a danger to the orthodoxy of those who engage in its study. In order to combat its detrimental influence, the anonymous author compiled the present compendium of orthodox tenets and dedicated it to the Muẓaffaridah Abū al-Fawāris Shāh Shujāʻ (d. 786/1384); it is divided into two qism (with fuither subdivisions):|الاول) فى مدارك العلوم|الثانى) فى مسالك الفهوم|The first qism deals with uṣūl al-fiqh according to Shāfiʻite and Ḥanafite schools (fol. 6a-32a), logic (32a-59b), and psychology (59b-65b); the second qism contains physics and metaphysics (65b-72b); then follows khātimah فى ذکر اقاوىل المعتزلة (72.b sqq.) The first qism begins on fol. 3a: ... القسم الاول فى مدارك العلوم مقدمة وثلثة فنون . المقدمة فى قول اجمالى فى المدارك والعلوم فصلان . الاول فى المدارك لما کان الانسان اشرف الانواع

Light cream glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible. The first 13 fol. are later additions and replacements. Table of contents on fol. 1b-2b. Explanation of the abbreviations used in the text on fol. 3b. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits a fol. between fol. 65 and 66). Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "AUT S 74".|Collation: Paper, fol. 104 ; ii (fol. 1-2 in the modern foliation ; smaller European paper, with table of contents) 110 (+1, before fol. 3 ; later replacements on European glazed paper) 2-1010 112 ; catchword on the verso of leaf 1, 2, 3, 8, 10 of each quire; most quires are numbered using Arabic numerals (see fol. 34a).|Copy completed on Saturday end of Shawwāl 979 by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Hādī al-Ṣanfūrī al-Shāfiʻī al-Qādirī in the Madrasat Abī ʻUmar, for the Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, whose grandfather is known as Marzanāt (colophon, fol. 103b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 3a, signed Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad(?) ; ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Bayṭār, dated 24 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1260 [May 13, 1844] ; ʻAbd al-Razzāq Ibn al-Shaykh Ḥasan ---? al-Sirāj(?). subject_as_recorded: Ibn al-Jazarī, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1350-1429. Nashr fī al-qirāʼāt al-ʻashr.--Abridgment|Qurʼan--Readings--Early works to 1800|Qurʼan--Recitation--Early works to 1800|Muslim scholars--Certification--History--15th century--Sources|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 123 leaves: paper ; 180 x 130 (120 x 95) mm. bound to 180 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings ; yāʼ for alif maqṣūrah; final yāʼ dotted; "hyphenation" (the last letters of some words at the end of a line are written on the next line). Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and chain lines (generally in groups of three) visible. Fol. 20-53 are later replacements (19 lines per page; European paper). Collation notes on the margin. Mention "buligha qirāʼatan" and "buligha muqābalatan bi-al-...?" throughout. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including verses of poetry and ownership statements. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (faulty).|Reading statement on fol. 121b.|Collation: Paper, fol. 123 ; 1-210 3-510 (European paper) 64 (European paper) 7-1210 1310 (- 1 at end of quire); catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on pastedown of the upper cover: "AUT S 60".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by ʻAlāʼ(?) ibn ʻAlī, known as Ibn Rāfiʻ al-Ḥanbalī madhhaban al-Muqaddasī (Maqdisī) nasaban al-... baladan, in the Jāmiʻ al-Ḥanābilah in Ṣāliḥīyah Dimashq, Tuesday 14 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 856 [Dec. 26, 1452] (fol. 122a, with ijāzah).|Several ownership statements and impression of one seal on fol. 1a and 122b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 63 leaves : paper ; 176 x 162 (150-157 x 130-140) mm bound to 175 x 165 mm.
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|On the title page is a statement that the book was bequeathed to a mosque on Mt. Qāsiyūn, outside of Damascus in 692 [1293]. Following the end of the text are two quotations (fol.57a) On the following folios is a short work captioned Min Kalām ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Muʻtazz (fol. 57b-63b) which begins "al-Adab ṣūrat al-ʻaql fa-ḥassana ʻaqlaka kayfa shiʼt" Title also on lower edge of text block. Inscriptions on both pastedowns.|Collation: Paper ; fol. 63 ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 12-18 lines per page ; ruled.|Description: Written in late Kufi ; paper tinted red ; MS in fair condition. Folio 63b largely illegible.|Origin: MS probably belongs to Xth century and is apparently unique.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals and foliation in black ink using arabic numerals (both omit the first fol.).|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Tafsīr 36". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 262".|Origin: According to the colophon, copy completed in the middle of Jumādá al-Ukhrá [sic] 867 [March 1463] by Ḥasan ibn ʻAbd al-Ṣamad|First fol.: Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad ibn Mūsá al-...bāʻī, dated 1226 H. Fol. 1a: Two ownership statement, one in the name of ...? ibn Rustam ibn Aḥmad ibn Maḥmūd al-SHRūlānī ; gift statement for ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Ūmīzdahnī(?) Qāḍī Dadah Afandī, from his father, with seal. note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 272a). The same title (without "Kitāb") appears on an inscription by a later hand on fol. 1a.|Physical description: 24 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with use of red (professional hand). Light cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and pulp visible. Ḥāshiyah on the margins of the beginning of the text. Occasional marginal annotations throughout. Several inscriptions, including ownership statements on fol. 1a. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Title on tail of text block. Lower part of last fol. (fol. 272) cut off. Upper part of fol. 129-227 eaten by rodents, with loss of text of annotations.|Inscription in Arabic numerals on a hand-made label pasted on the upper cover: "425".|Origin: According to the colophon, copy completed on Friday 10 Ṣafar 1087 [April 24, 1676] by Jalāl ibn Muḥammad Khān ... al-Lāhijānī (fol. 272a, partly in Persian, followed by verses).|Copyist: Jalāl ibn Muḥammad Khān al-Lāhijānī.|Impression of two stamps on fol. 1b (one repeated on fol. 272a). Inscription dated 1339 H. on fol. 1a.

physical_description: Extent: 196 leaves : paper ; 206 x 142 (145 x 80) mm bound to 206 x 150 mm.
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title supplied by the cataloger (after text no. 2 in the collection).|Ms. additions: the main texts are interspersed with numerous ms. additions, including accounting lists and calculations (inside upper cover, fol. 1a, 22a-b etc.), prayers, a short inscription on mysterious properties of letters accompanied by a talisman table (on fol. 98a), invocations of ʻAlī (fol. 131b-132a), and short texts (fol. 74a, 147a, and the one on fol. 98b-99a).|Texts vary in terms of style, hands and paper. They are all written in black ink with some of them using red for rubrication. They are mostly written in small to very small and casual nastaʻlīq, and a smaller number are in naskh, some vocalised. Number of lines per page ranges from 6 (in poetry, e.g. text 6) to 25 in prose texts. Most texts have catchwords (on the verso of each leaf). Paper varies from text to text and is mostly glazed European.|Origin: Text 6 is dated 20th of Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1002 (1593) -- colophon (fol. 61b). Text 9 was copied by Muḥammad bin Aḥmad bin Muḥammad bin Badr al-Dīn ibn Zayn al-Dīn ... [?] al-Shāfiʻī, in Dār al-Shifāʼ in Miṣr [Cairo?], and was completed on the 19th of Muḥarram 1046 (1636) -- colophon (fol. 78b). Text 14 was copied by Selim Nutkî, a scribe at the Zaǧra-yi Atik (Eski Zagra or Stara Zagora) Courthouse, and was completed on the 25th of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1169 (1756) -- colophon (fol. 146b).|Ownership signature in the name of Mustafa el-Kutubî bin el-hac Ahmet, a scribe at the Cisr-i Ergene Courthouse, accompanied by his stamp, is found on the first page of most of the texts throughout the ms.

Small pieces of paper with prayers placed between fol. 85 and 86.|Collation: Paper; fol. i + 185 + iii; catchwords; chiefly quaternions; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 17-18 lines per page.|Description: Overlining in red; watermarks; the leaves are dyed in blue.|Origin: According to colophons, copied by Mahdī ibn Ibrāhīm, or Muḥammad Mahdī Ibn Ibrāhīm, al-Kahdamī (fol. 75b) al-Rashtī (fol. 185a), from Ramaḍān to Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1236 [June-Aug. 1821] (fol. 45a, 49a, 52b, 75b, 79a, 82b, 87a, 93a, 112a, 132a, 177b, 185a). One colophon mentions the Ribāt Pusht-i Bādām (fol. 49a). The Kitāb al-Fawāʼid al-Riḍāwīyah was written on the margin of fol. 126b-142a by Murtaḍá Ibn Muḥammad Ṣādiq al-Ṭ---, known as Farhang, Tehran, 1313 H. sh. [1935] (fol. 142a).

physical_description: Extent: 2 v. (ii + 756, ii + 877 + ii) leaves: paper ; 298 x 198 (233 x 129) mm. bound to 300 x 205 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from beginning of text (vol. 1, fol. 1b).|28 lines per page in vol. 1; 33 lines per page in vol. 2. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within a border consisting of two magenta lines throughout (gold on the first two pages of the text, vol. 1, fol. 1b-2a). Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold, blue violet, orange and white on vol. 1, fol. 1b. Vol. 2 has no title page. Glazed European paper. Flyleaves on thick European paper with watermark "Tre lune" . Vol. 1, fol. 754a-756a blank with frame. Inscription on fol. 756b. Collation notes and a few annotations on the margins. The quires are numbered using Arabic numerals in the form "K 2" (see vol. 1, fol. 11a ; "Kurrās 1" on vol. 1, fol. 2a). Catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Copy of vol. 1 completed on 23 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1207 by ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir Shaṭṭī al-Baghdādī (colophon, fol. 753b). On this copyist, see see ʻUlamāʼ Dimashq wa-aʻyānuhā fī al-qarn al-thālith ʻashar al-Hijrī , 1991, vol. 1, p. 11.|Former owners: al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Amīn ibn al-Ḥājj Khiḍr al-Shaṭṭī al-Baghdādī al-Ḥanbalī al-Qādirī (d. 1243 H. [1827 or 8], see ʻUlamāʼ Dimashq wa-aʻyānuhā fī al-qarn al-thālith ʻashar al-Hijrī , 1991, vol. 1, p. 343; ownership statement dated 1207 [1792 or 3] on vol. 1, fol. 1a, and undated on vol. 1 fol. 753b and on vol. 2, fol. 877a) ; Muḥammad al-Ḥamrawī (ownership statement dated 1305? [1887 or 8] on fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 222 leaves: paper ; 290 x 210 (200 x 130) mm. bound to 290 x 220 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 220b).|Incipit: عن ابى هرون العبدى عن ابى سعيد الخذري قال سمعت رسول الله صلعم غير مرّة ولا مرّتين يقول فى آخر صلوته ... سبحان ربك ربّ العزّة عمّا يصفون ... تفسير سورة ص اخبرنا ابو سعد محمد بن علي الخفّاف|Explicit: وقرأت قل هو الله احد وقل اعوذ بربّ الفلق وقل اعوذ بربّ الناس سكن او ذهب وهذا آخر تفسير القرآن المجيد المعروف بالوسيط|Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in medium small taʻlīq in black ink with use of red to overline the commented text. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Occasional marginal annotations, including excerpts from a Sharḥ al-ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah (see fol. 19a). Waqf (see mention on the upper margin of fol. 2b). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "2"(?). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1355". Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. 1a: "Tafsīr 62".|Collation: Paper, fol. 222 ; 110 (-1, before fol. 1) 2-2010 21-228 238 (-1, after fol. 222) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: Copy completed on Sunday 5 Muḥarram 895 [Nov. 29, 1489] in Bahnām(?), a village from Wādī ... (?) by Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān (colophon, fol. 220b).|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb (ownership statement dated 1289 H. [1872 or 3] on fol. 2a). Ownership statement dated 1216 H. [1801 or 2] in the name of Muḥammad saʻīd ibn Aḥmad, who acquired the volume from ʻUbayd Allāh Efendi al-Bukhārī. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī, Naṣr ibn Muḥammad, -983?
author_as_recorded_agr: ابو الليث السمرقندي، نصر بن محمد
physical_description: Extent: 330 leaves: paper ; 280 x 180 (200 x 125) mm. bound to 280 x 200 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page by a later hand (fol. 1a).|Incipit: سورة مريم ثمان وتسعون اية كلها مكية يسم الله الرحمن الرحيم وبه نستعين كهيعص قراء ابن كثير وعاصم فى رواية حفص بنصب الهاء والياء|Explicit: سورة الناس مدنية وهى ست ايات بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قوله تعالى قل اعوذ بربّ الناس يقول استعيذ بخالق الناس ... [324أ] ... قال من لم يزعم انّهما من كتاب الله تعالى فعليه لعنة الله والملائكة اجمعين تم كتاب تفسير ابى الليث نصر بن ابراهبم السمرقندى|Physical description: 24 lines per page. Written in small taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for overlining, re-inking and "maṭlab" on the margins. Light biscuit paper with pulp and thick laid lines visible. Occasional marginal annotation. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Fol. 1 and 324 consist of a leaf in European paper with watermark pasted on the recto and the verso respectively of an original folio. Some leaves apparently missing (see between fol. 13 and 14). Note on a modern piece of paper placed between fol. 3 and 4. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Raqm 43". Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (faulty). Water damage; mildew.|Origin: Copy completed on 8 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 892 [March 4, 1487] (colophon, fol. 324a, followed by verses of poetry on the margin, 2 lines in Arabic, 2 lines in Persian).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Būshanjī, al-Hayṣam ibn Muḥammad, active 11th century
physical_description: Extent: 314 leaves : paper ; 297 x 203 (229 x 136) mm. bound to 301 x 223 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a). Part of the rest of the title is obliterated, reading : "wa-huwa [...] min kitābihi raḥimahu Allāh taʻālā" (see also colophon, fol. 343b: "tamma hadh[...] min hādhā al-kitāb").|In the Persian translation of this work (see GAL, SI, 592), the author's name is Abū al-Ḥasan ibn Hayṣam. The name Ibn Hayṣam is also written on two modern labels on our ms. (on the pastedown of the upper and lower cover respectively). For the date 400 H. [1009] associated to the author, see fol. 213b.|29 lines per page, verses of poetry in two columns. Written in thick medium large naskh in black ink with use of red (R. Mach: Yemenite hand), on European glazed paper (frame-ruled, 7 mm.). The text is framed in two red lines throughout. A few notes in the margin. Ownership statement on fol. 1a. Stamp on the lower cover. Label on pastedown of the upper and of the lower cover mentioning the title in Arabic, the date of the copy in Western numerals and the inscription "ELS no. 49". Foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Copied by [...] ibn ʻAlī al-Zankalūnī on Friday 16 Rajab 1116 (colophon, fol. 313b).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from lower edge of text block.|Marginal notes and summaries; evidently trimmed as some pages have folded edges to preserve notes. Opening spread frame-ruled in gold (v. 1, f. 1b-2a)|Origin: Probably from XVIIIth century.|Obscured ownership signature dated [1]250 (v. 1, f. 1a); seal impression: Sharīfah Khadījah (v. 2, f. 89a). physical_description: Extent: 470 leaves: paper ; 328 x 225 (225 x 155) mm. bound to 328 x 230 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Physical description: 34 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red (gold outlined in black on fol. 4b). Ḥāshiyah on the margins. Biscuit paper with thick laid lines, chain lines, and pulp visible. Fol. 50-62, 213-225: later replacements. Fol. (i) and 1 are later additions, with a table of contents. Erased inscriptions on fol. 469b. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "1" on fol. 5a). Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.). Wear. Disbound.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on 20 Muḥarram 697 [Nov. 7, 1297] by Abī ʻAlī ...? ibn Abī al-Riḍā ibn QLM ibn ---LRūdī al-Nāṣirī (fol. 468b). Text collated on the copy of al-Imām al-Ṣaghānī by al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ṣaghānī (collation statement, fol. 468b after colophon).|Several inscriptions including ownership statements, some with seal, on fol. 4a, one reading Fakhr Zādah Muḥammad Asʻad al-Ḥusaynī. Ownership statement dated 1085 H. on fol. 468b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 276 leaves : paper ; 322 x 224 (160 x 85) mm. bound to 320 x 230 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription on fol. 276b (later hand).|Physical description: 21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq. Frame on fol. 3b-4a. European paper with watermark (Tre Lune). Ḥāshiyah on the margins of the beginning of the text (fol. 3b-5a). Kabīkaj on the pastedown of the upper cover. A few leaves mended; stained with dampness. Between fol. 123 and 124 are five pieces of paper with short texts (a few others are found throughout the copy).|Decoration: Naively executed headpiece on fol. 3b.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by ʻAlī ibn al-Mullā ʻIbādī ibn al-Mullā Aḥmad ibn al-Mullā Ṣāliḥ ibn al-Mullā Muḥammad al-Zaylī ... al-Hayābī ... al-Shafiʻī, and completed on Sunday 12 Shaʻbān 1133 [June 8, 1721] (fol. 276b).|Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, in the name of ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ibrāhīm ... al-muftī bi-Baṣrah ... al-Ḥalalī al-Ḥanafī, from his father; and in the name of ... ibn Ibrāhīm, from his brother ʻAbd Allāh. Impressions of square stamps on fol. 3b, two bearing the inscription "ʻAbduhu Ṣadr al-Dīn" (repeated throughout). Ownership statements, one apparently dated 1212 H. and impressions of stamps on fol. 276b.

subject_as_recorded: Qurʼan--Commentaries|Qurʼan--Commentaries--History--12th century--Sources|Coran--Commentaires|Coran--Commentaires--Histoire--12e siècle--Sources|Qurʼan|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 318, ii leaves : paper ; 302 x 195 (190 x 110) mm. bound to 310 x 205 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription on fol. 3a.|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in small naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. European paper with watermark, glossy. Fol. 1-2 are later additions. Table of contents on fol. 3a. Foliation in black ink using arabic numerals (starts with "1" on fol. 4a).|Chiefly quinions ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription "307" in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the upper cover (repeated in Roman and Arabic numerals on fol. 1a).|Origin: According to colophons, Juzʼ 8 completed on 27 Ṣafar 1005 [Oct. 20, 1596] (fol. 106a in the foliation in Arabic numerals) and juzʼ 10 completed on Tuesday 8 Rajab [Feb. 25, 1597] (fol. 316b), the latter mentioning the name of the copyist: Jaʻfar ibn Shams al-Dīn.|Ownership statement dated 1273 H. on fol. 3a.
